panels.visual: Wide training montage: In the hidden rooms behind the wine shop, Bansi learns the arts of the Bahn-Sa-Sahn. Split imagery shows her picking ever more complex locks, moving through shadows, practicing with daggers against training partners. Two years of transformation from runaway princess to professional thief.
panels.narration: She trained with the Bahn-Sa-Sahn for two years, learning the craft of thievery not as common crime but as art. She learned to pick any lock, to move through shadows like smoke, to disguise herself so completely that her own teachers sometimes failed to recognize her.

panels.visual: Wide shot of brutal combat training. Bansi faces multiple opponents in a training circle, daggers in both hands. Blood from a cut on her arm, but her eyes are focused, cold. The Bahn-Sa-Sahn do not teach the formal combat of soldiers - they teach the brutal, efficient violence of those who live on the edge.
panels.dialogue: ThiefMentor: "And she learned to fight - not formal combat, but the brutal efficiency of those who live on the edge."
panels.narration: She learned where to strike to disable or kill, to read an opponent's movements, to exploit every weakness.
